intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium poliostelium, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant features upright, hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped with serrated edges. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in dense clusters at the top of the stems. Hieracium poliostelium is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it plays a role in supporting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
